title: Error Firefox
content:
Hello,

I am looking for help with a Windows 11 Pro 24H2 system. Firefox no longer works despite a clean uninstall and reinstall, including deleting all related folders.

When I reinstall Firefox, the error appears, but the application still manages to launch. However, after a system restart, the issue comes back.

When launching Firefox, I get the following message: “Firefox.exe failed to start correctly (error 0xC0000022).”

I can’t find any recent information about this issue. Thank you in advance for your help.

title: Not enough, Mozilla
content:
Saying "you can turn off the AI" is NOT enough, Mozilla. Nothing is ever "turned off" unless it's completely removed. This is Microsoft's playbook BS; "but you can turn it off", but for some reason the system is always using a metric ton of memory, lagging and whatnot. You, of all companies, should know this and be better than that. Nothing good is ever force-installed and impossible to remove. Unless you all make it installed completely separately so people like me, who are a significant part, if not most of your user base, can not install it, nothing short of a full renunciation of the CEO will suffice to make we trust you again.

"Internet for People, not profit" is seeming more and more like blatant false advertising every day.
creator: PissedOffWithAIUser

title: Browser Data Recovery
content:
So long story short I was trying to selectively wipe a cache for an unrelated site to get up to date information, and in the process I accidentally wiped my browser data for a chat site I use.

I clicked "clear browsing data" and set it for the last hour, thinking it would only y'know, delete the last hour of content. I had the chat site open at the time, it didn't log me out of anything, and all of those logs were still there as far as I could tell.

Come today, I log on to the chat site, and all of my conversations are gone. And I would very much appreciate getting them back if possible. No I have not recently updated my F-list backups or anything of the sort, so my only option is to find where the (deleted) browser data is stored and recover it from there. Which I really, really hope is possible.

Please help.
creator: jpw94
